meanings.definition: A secret language used by Irish Travellers.
meanings.sent1: The Irish Travellers communicated in shelta to keep their conversations private.
meanings.sent2: Learning shelta can help you understand the unique culture of Irish Travellers.
meanings.sent3: I tried speaking shelta to my friend, but they just looked confused!
meanings.sent4: To me, shelta sounds like a mysterious code waiting to be cracked.
meanings.sent5: The sound of shelta being spoken was like music to my ears.

meanings.definition: A type of temporary shelter or covering.
meanings.sent1: During the camping trip, we set up a shelta to protect ourselves from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The shelta provided a cozy spot for us to rest after a long hike.
meanings.sent3: I pretended our shelta was a magical castle, and we were the brave knights defending it!
meanings.sent4: Under the shelta, we felt safe and shielded from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The colorful shelta fluttered in the wind, creating a cheerful atmosphere.
